runs.comm: full on leg stump, sweetly flicked away but he picks out midwicket who then lets it through his hands
dragged down short and that's an imperious pull from the in-form Hales, he's seeing it like a football, and dispatches it behind square
fuller, but again angled into the pads, glances away fine without any contact on the bat
pulls another short one, this time gets the toe-end of the bat and the ball dribbles to midwicket
gets underneath the ball this time, pulling again, back of a length and it goes high in the air over midwicket then falls into space deep on the leg side
gets it very full outside off, squirted down to third man to end a lively first over for England
he starts with a short ball and also gets hammered behind square as Hales unleashes a crisp pull...suggest they need to pitch up a touch
fuller at off stump, defended into the covers
that's sweet! This is a full ball, but Hales deals with it effortlessly. Slanting into the pads and he flicks it up in the air over deep square leg. Terrific timing
superb timing! Blimey, he's in some firm, this time he leans forward into another full ball and plays the perfect on-drive which races to the straight boundary
ouch...Rabada gets a boot on this straight drive which was pinged off the middle, good job, too, as it might have been heading to the boundary as well
good delivery, yorker at middle and off, dug out into the leg side
now it's Roy's turn...takes a couple of strides down the pitch and clobbers a length delivery over midwicket with a beautifully clean swing of the bat. Caught in the crowd!
short outside off and this gets slotted through midwicket along the ground this time, Roy dragging the ball with a pull shot
slower ball, slips down the leg side, called a wide...South Africa under early pressure
gives himself room to the leg side, Abbott follows him with a length delivery and it actually zips past Roy's outside edge even though he was stood outside leg stump
full and straight, a crisp flick through midwicket but deep square is just able to flick it back
giving himself room outside leg again, plays a punchy drive and the ball isn't far from carrying to cover but the fielders are hanging on the edge of the circle
poor ball, full outside leg stump, but he gets away with it as Roy flicks it straight to deep square leg
full at leg stump, think it was a low full toss, clipped straight to midwicket
moves outside leg stump, clubbed into the leg side without much timing
full and straight, driven off the bottom of the bat towards mid-on
picks out the man this time! Back of a length, back-of-the-hand slower ball, Roy going for the pull and it's taken at midwicket. Smart bowling from Rabada
he's away straightaway with a trademark back foot square drive which goes wide of third man
full, angled into the pads, deflects into the off side...was heading well down leg side. Rabada settles South Africa a touch
just short! Starts with a short ball on leg stump, this was a tactic in the one-day series, Root pulls and it doesn't quite reach short fine leg
swing and a miss as he aims straight down the ground to a length delivery
worked off the pads to deep square
full, angling into middle and leg, not far off being a good yorker but Hales gets a tickle on it and deflects it fine of short fine leg
heaves a length ball into the leg side and picks out midwicket

dropped, a low chance at deep midwicket! Hales moving to the leg side, gets a top half of the bat on the ball, it appears to carrying nicely to Duminy but he had to come forward at the last moment and couldn't hang on
he misses a pull this time and gets a blow in the stomach...goes down on his knees to catch his breath for a moment
full and drive to the left of mid-off
big full toss but Root can't take advantage as he drives to cover
back of a length, Root gets a bottom edge as he's through his pull a fraction early and it bobbles to the keeper
another full toss, a straighter one this time, and again Root picks out the fielder as he clips to midwicket
slower ball outside off, Root waited for it then placed it perfectly square through the off side...nice way for England to end the Powerplay
works a straight delivery down to long on
gets his head over the ball and whips it along the ground to deep midwicket
full and wide, jabbed into the covers

what a catch! But almost a nasty collision as well! Goodness me...Hales top edges a sweep, the ball goes miles into the air behind square on the leg side. Rabada, running back from short fine leg, and Duminy coming in from deep square both go for the catch. Duminy takes the catch, then Rabada charges into him like a rugby tackle the Springboks would be proud off and, remarkably, Duminy is able to cling onto the catch. Rabada looks a little dazed, but seems okay
fired in outside leg stump, pushed to the off side
down the pitch on the line outside off stump, clips through midwicket
and another! Not his best delivery, but it doesn't matter. A length ball outside off, Root tries to drive it square through the off side but picks out point
length ball outside off, pushed to backward point
flicks a delivery from outside off into midwicket
good bowling from Wiese, tight around off stump, Stokes pushes into the covers
full, he drives gently down to long off to get off the mark
nearly another catch! Width to Morgan who slices it over a leaping backward point, wasn't in control of the short but gets it wide of third man in the end
juicy full toss outside off and Stokes drills it through the offside, bisecting deep cover and long off
that's outta here! Goes down on his back knee and slog sweeps Tahir out of the ground over deep midwicket
brilliant bowling! Lovely stuff from Tahir, he beats Stokes with the googly and he's stranded down the pitch. A simple stumping for de Villiers
goes back and tucks this off his pads to short fine leg
finds short leg again
length ball outside off which he carefully places out to deep cover
back of a length at off stump, defended to backward point
touch wider outside off, guided down to third man
short of a length outside off, pushed square into the off side
pushed into the off side
outside edge as he tries to glide this to third man, lands short of de Villiers who can't gather it cleanly
drop and run into the off side, played down by his feet and that's a good piece of running
on a length at off stump, pushed into the covers
straight line, played into midwicket
full at off stump, driven down the ground
short outside off stump, pulled firmly to deep square leg...Buttler just needing to bide his time
full outside off, squirted down to third man off a thick outside edge as he drives
driven firmly into the pitch and it bounces to cover...a crowd catch
pushes forward to a ball outside off and eases it down the ground
uses his feet to a full ball outside off but just ends up nudging back down the pitch to the bowler
full at off stump, a sweetly struck drive but straight to cover
a slower ball, full and straight, clipped to long on
chopped away from outside off and finds backward point
another dot ball, the pressure grows, as Morgan tries to dab this down to third man but gets it so fine that de Villiers can gather
width outside off and driven firmly to deep cover

another for Tahir, he's a heck of a force with the white ball...it was outside off, Morgan aiming over the leg side having perhaps picked it as the googly but gets a thick top edge which loops to short third man
he's on a hat-trick! Moeen has driven a full delivery to cover, where it's superbly held diving to his left by the captain. Somebody catch Tahir, please. He's off again.
so, so, so, close! How did that miss! A wonderful googly from Tahir, beats Jordan's inside edge as he comes forward but somehow it misses the top of the stumps. Tahir thought he had it (so did I)
pushed into the off side
beaten again! A legspinner that grips and spins past the outside edge this time. Isn't taken cleanly, but no nick. What an over from Tahir.
full outside off, driven to long off
full at off stump, touch of extra bounce as Jordan takes his bottom hand off the bat
steers it through a gap at point to the sweeper
gets across outside off and tucked into midwicket
short ball, gets a top edge on the hook and it loops over short fine leg
driven down the ground so he'll keep the strike
worked off the stumps into the leg side
goes back in the crease and flicks this from outside off through the leg side...and there's nearly a mix-up! Buttler started to come back for a second, but was able to get back
pushed into the covers
fiddles a length ball behind square on the leg side
slides down the leg side
pushed into the off side, Buttler hasn't been able to free his arms so far
just a fraction short and it's crunched down the ground with a crisp pull, but straight to long on
chipped down the ground with a lofted drive which he places with just the right pace to allow them back for a second
angled into the pads but he picks out square leg
gives himself a touch of room to the leg side, it's a full ball outside off which he is able to slice between short third man and backward point
slower ball, dabbed to backward point
somehow he gets this down to fine leg, a well-directed short ball over middle and leg, Jordan takes his eyes off the ball, almost trying to swat it away, and the edge evades the keeper
full and straight, driven into the covers
poor line, full outside leg, clipped fine but long leg is able to get around - good work by Morris
bouncer, over middle, Jordan ducks...think he was looking for the wide
held at the third attempt! Jordan moving to the leg side, Abbott follows him with a slower, shorter delivery and he clubs it to Miller at midwicket who takes it with a juggle (three grabs, actually)
driven on the up over the covers to the sweeper
slower short ball again, Buttler paddles it into the leg side
full toss at the pads, Rashid misses out...another dot ball
he started moving to the leg side, Morris tried to follow him and ended up pushing this miles down the leg side
adjusts the line, full a off stump, driven square through the covers and Rossouw makes an excellent sliding save on the deep point boundary
full and speared down the leg side again
short outside off, pulled through square leg (in every sense) and there's no one who can cut that off
width outside off, carved away square through the off side and the sweeper is swiftly onto it
full outside off, for some reason Rashid leaves it alone
full at leg stump, well bowled, spears between bat and pad
good delivery, full at off stump, opens the face and runs it down third man
full outside off, Rashid tries to carve it away over backward point but can't clear the man who takes it above his head
round the wicket, full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
good yorker outside off, drilled to deep cover
driven down the ground
length ball, a slower delivery, opens the face and pushes it wide of short third man
jabbed wide of point, another full, wide delivery which only costs a single
full and wide outside off, squirted to backward point to give Buttler the strike
a short ball over leg stump and it's too short...extra ball (and run) for England
well bowled, very full, Buttler can only swing it out to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, heaved into the leg side but he finds deep midwicket
good stuff, keeping it full, Buttler's bottom hand comes into play as he digs it out down the ground
brings out the reverse sweep for the first time, it's a low full toss, he connects well but it goes straight to short third man
full and straight, swung down the ground to long off and they are able to scamper back for the second
